page.title: 01Review of the area.
page.content: North Shields is a town situated to the North of the River Tyne approximatey 8 miles to the East of Newcastle.The town has always been closely identified with the fishing industry and the word 'Shields' derives from the Anglo-Saxon word 'schele' which means a temporary fisherman's hut. By the turn of the century the town had grown as had the trade on the River Tyne and the population was largely employed in the basic industies of fishing,shipbuilding & railways.In the 18 & 19 centuries many coal mines had opperated but they largely exhausted by 1900. Today the traditional industries of N.Shields are in decline and unemployment is a fact of life amongst the population of 41608.The fishing fleet is much reduced in size and the
